newsitem.title: USA: U.S. Mid-Atlantic power firm amid Pa. nuke startup.
newsitem.headline: U.S. Mid-Atlantic power firm amid Pa. nuke startup.

text.p: Spot U.S. Mid-Atlantic bulk electricity prices remained firm Thursday amid the startup of the 1,100 megawatt (MW) Peach Bottom 2 nuclear power plant in Delta, Pa., market sources said.
The unit, operated by PECO Energy Co, tripped off line Tuesday due to an electrical problem with the turbine generator.
Warmer-than-normal autumn weather in the southern portion of the Pennsylvania-New Jersey-Maryland (PJM) Interconnect district triggered some cooling demand, traders and brokers said.
"We actually have a little air-conditioning load," said a PJM trader.
However, the latest forecasts showed temperatures in the upper portion of the eastern seaboard would decline sharply Friday if a cold front were to arrive as expected.
Several large PJM generating stations were planned to resume operation from scheduled refueling and maintenance in the next several days.
GPU Generation Inc today said a 850 MW unit at the Conemaugh coal-fired facility in western Pennsylvania would return on line today after being shut Sept 22 for maintenance.
Firm, peak electricity for Friday delivery was quoted at $23.00-$24.50 a megawatt hour (MWh), compared with Wednesday's $23.75-$24.75.
Friday PJM power during off-peak hours was notationally pegged in the $13.00-$16.00 range.
PJM electricity for Saturday was assessed near $18.25 and Sunday $17.00.
Firm, peak PJM deliveries for the rest of October were quoted again at $22.50-$23.50.
November PJM electricity was assessed at $23.00-$23.50, a wider range than $23.00-$23.25 on Wednesday.
December PJM power was pegged at $27.00-$27.45, compared with Wednesday's $27.00-$27.25.
January/February 1997 PJM was discussed at $31.00-$31.60, versus a quote of $31.00-$31.50 on Wednesday.
First quarter 1997 PJM was quoted at $28.90-$29.10, against $29.00-$29.10 on Wednesday.
Second quarter 1997 PJM electricity was valued at $21.75-$22.25, flat from Wednesday.
July/August 1997 deliveries was pegged at $31.00-$31.35, compared with a quote near $31.35 on Wednesday.
